description: Fast and simple Node.js version manager, built in Rust.

root.name: alias
tip: Alias a version to a common name

root.name: completions
tip: Print shell completions to stdout

root.name: current
tip: Print the current Node.js version

root.name: default
tip: Set a version as the default version

root.name: env
tip: Print and set up required environment variables for fnm

root.name: exec
tip: Run a command within fnm context

root.name: help
tip: Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

root.name: install
tip: Install a new Node.js version

root.name: list
tip: List all locally installed Node.js versions

root.name: list-remote
tip: List all remote Node.js versions

root.name: unalias
tip: Remove an alias definition

root.name: uninstall
tip: Uninstall a Node.js version

root.name: use
tip: Change Node.js version

options.name: --version
tip: Show the version.

common_options.name: --arch
tip: U: --arch <ARCH>
Override the architecture of the installed Node binary.
Defaults to arch of fnm binary

common_options.name: --corepack-enabled
tip: Enable corepack support for each new installation.
This will make fnm call `corepack enable` on every Node.js installation.
For more information about corepack see <https://nodejs.org/api/corepack.html>

common_options.name: --fnm-dir
tip: U: --fnm-dir <BASE_DIR>
The root directory of fnm installations.

common_options.name: --help
tip: Show the help.

common_options.name: --log-level
tip: U: --log-level <LOG_LEVEL>
The log level of fnm commands.
Default: info

common_options.name: --node-dist-mirror
tip: U: --node-dist-mirror <NODE_DIST_MIRROR>
Set the mirror URL for downloading Node.js dist.
Default: https://nodejs.org/dist

common_options.name: --resolve-engines
tip: Resolve `engines.node` field in `package.json` whenever a `.node-version` or `.nvmrc` file is not present.
Experimental: This feature is subject to change.
Note: `engines.node` can be any semver range, with the latest satisfying version being resolved.

common_options.name: --version-file-strategy
tip: U: --version-file-strategy <VERSION_FILE_STRATEGY>
A strategy for how to resolve the Node version.
Used whenever `fnm use` or `fnm install` is called without a version, or when `--use-on-cd` is configured on evaluation.
Default: local

next.name: local
tip: Use the local version of Node defined within the current directory

next.name: recursive
tip: Use the version of Node defined within the current directory and all parent directories
